author: Fuseworks Media
title: On The Nation this weekend
text:
Friday, 16 October, 2015 - 12:28 
This weekend on The Nation... 
From Dirty Politics to the TPP, the way governments release official information has become increasingly controversial. Lisa Owen sits down with the Chief Ombudsman Dame Beverley Wakem as she nears the end of a major review of the Official Information Act and asks if it has become too politicised and whether she needs more power. 
Then one of John Key’s political mentors, the man who spearheaded New Zealand’s successful bid for a seat on the United Nations Security Council, Sir Jim McLay. Now a special envoy for the Prime Minister and special adviser to Foreign Minister Murray McCully, Sir Jim talks about his new Middle East role amid talk of a third Palestinian intifada. 
And Andrew Little as you’ve never seen him before….Torben Akel goes along for the ride. 
We’ll discuss all this and the weeks big news stories with our panel: Politics columnist Jane Clifton, Metro’s Simon Wilson, and the New Zealand Herald investigative reporter David Fisher. 
The Nation on TV3, 9.30am Saturdays and 10am Sundays, and 7pm Saturdays on Radio Live. Proudly brought to you by New Zealand on Air’s Platinum Fund.
